content: super slouch this quick hat is great for a lazy day when you d rather cover your hair than deal with it with plenty of stretch and a bit of style it ll keep you comfy and warm seed stitch interspersed with columns of knit stitches will keep you engaged as you knit and catch the eye when worn if you d like to make a less slouchy version cast on only 80 stitches and leave out one repeat yarn downton abbey branson 80% acrylic 20% wool 153 yards per 3 5 ounces ​ color chestnut brown 1 skein needles us size 6 4mm 16 circular us size 8 5mm 16 circular and a set of us ​ size 8 5mm dpns gauge 4 stitches and 6 row in seed stitch pattern ​ finished measurements 10 from brim to crown 23 around base ​ 1 brim cast on 88 stitches on size 6 4mm circular place marker for beginning of row and join being careful not to twist r1-6 *k1 p1* repeat to end body switch to larger circular needles r1 *k2 p1 k1* repeat until end of row r2 *k1 p1* repeat until end of row repeat row 1 and 2 a total of 26 times crown during decreases switch to dpns when needed r1 *ssk p1 k3 p1 k1* repeat to end of row r2 *k2 p1 k1 p1 k1 p1* repeat to end of row r3 *ssk k3 p1 k1* repeat to end of row r4 *k1 p1* repeat to end of row r5 *ssk k2 p1 k1* repeat to end of row r6 *k2 p1 k1 p1* repeat to end of row r7 *ssk k1 p1 k1* repeat to end of row r8 *ssk k1 p1* repeat to end of row r9 *ssk k1* repeat to end of row r10 *ssk* repeat to end of row r11 *ssk* repeat 4 more times k1 snip yarn and sew the tail through the remaining eight stitches a couple of times weave in ends and flaunt it 2
